awd_titl_txt: Experimental Studies of Atoms in Confined Spaces (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: Cavity QED investigations are being continued into the                     properties of atoms confined to a very narrow space between two                 plane mirrors.  In this situation energy levels and radiation                   rates are modified, sometimes dramatically, by the interaction                  between the atom and the metallic boundaries.  It is now                        planned to measure spectroscopically the van der Waals shifts                   of the levels when atoms are placed at well defined locations                   within the channel and subsequently excited into a highly                       polarizable Rydberg state.  The position is manipulated using                   the force produced by a standing wave of laser light; the atoms                 are trapped in the lowest vibrational quantum states of the                     optical potential wells centered on the nudes of the standing                   water.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
